text: [Music]
hello I'm cladio Cloud support engineer
and E2 Windows here at AWS office in
Sydney today I'm going to show you how
to retrieve the administrator password
when you receive the password is not
available error message let's get
started if you're still receiving this
error after the 4 minutes Waits then
verify whether you're already manually
configure the local administrator
account password easy to launch for
Windows 2016 and later and easy to
config for Windows 2012 and earlier are
responsible for randomly generating and
sending the password to the Ws
Management console by default E2 Windows
instances that are launched from a
public Amazon machine image or Ami are
configured to automatically run these
tasks if you launch an instance from
your own generated Ami then you must
manually run these tasks otherwise the
password will be the same as the
original systems password let me show
you how to configure easy to lunch or
ec2 config note in this first scenario
we already have access to the original
password first the procedure requires a
system restart so if you're using a
public IP address that is an anelastic
IP address then when you stop and start
the instance a different public IP
address will be assigned to your
instance
to use the Amazon ec2 console open the
console then use RDP to connect to your
windows
instance from the Windows start menu
enter ec2 choose either ec2 launch
settings for Windows 2016 and later or
E2 config service settings for Windows
2012 and earlier
for administrator password choose random
next choose shutdown without cprep when
you use shutdown with cprep cprep
removes unique information to
standardize your Ami this allows you to
launch multiple copies of your instances
note that when you use cprep for an
instance that is domain joined cprep
remove the instance from the domain so
do not select this option in your
production environment
now I'll open the Amazon easy to console
and then select the instance make sure
to wait until the instance is in the
fully stopped status next I'm going to
create my Ami every instance that I will
launch from this Ami will invoke ec2
launch or ec2 config choose actions
image and templates and then create
image for image name enter an image
name for image description enter an
image
description if needed you can specify
different settings or add a
tag then choose create image you can now
start the
instance after a few minutes you can
then decrypt the password with your
keyer all ec2 instances that launch from
this new Ami will decrypt the password
with a key
PA now I use Windows Powershell for the
same procedure use this procedure only
for ec2 launch and on Windows 2016 and
2019 connect to your ec2
instance open Windows Powershell with
administrative
permissions run the following
command then stop the instance and
create the Ami the scripts runs only
once during the next boot it then
inactivates the tasks so they don't run
in the future unless you manually invoke
them let's see now a second scenario
where there is no access to the original
password in this case we assume that
your instance is managed by AWS system
manager or SSM open the ECU console
select your instance and click on
connect
from the session manager tab click again
on
connect this will open a new web browser
tab with a power local session to your
instance type the following command net
space user space administrator followed
by your new
password you can now use the newly
created password to connect to your
instance using RDP node it is a best pro
practice to change the administrator
password from the default generated one
to your own password if there is still a
need to have a default generated
password using your keeper you can now
go back to the first scenarios so now
you know how to retrieve the
administrator password when you receive
the password is not available yet error
message thanks for watching an EP cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
